DOC.brief_summary: Is MynxGrip ( test device ) non-inferior manuel compression ( standard comparator ) incidence adverse access site related event in-hospital , 30 day 6 month .
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Comparison MynxGrip Vascular Closure Device Manual Compression Closure After Femoral Access Angiography . The Closure Devices Used Every Day Practice Study , CLOSE-UP III Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Prospective , randomize ( 1:1 ) , control , non-blinded , single center study 2000 patient compare MynxGrip ( test device ) manuel compression ( standard comparator ) . Safety efficacy endpoint report in-hospital , 30 day 6 month .
DOC.criteria: > 18 year Should able provide valid inform sign consent CAG , possibly include intracoronary measurement ( FFR ) intracoronary imaging ( IVUS , optical coherence tomography ( OCT ) , NIRS ) Percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) procedure and/or implantation stent STElevations Myocardial Infarction ( STEMI ) Multiple puncture Active infection Groin haematoma closure procedure Known pseudoaneurysm arteriovenous ( AV ) fistula ipsilateral groin Cardiogenic shock Prior peripheral arterial surgery abdomen low extremity Sheat size > 7 F Life expectancy less one year Possible pregnancy positive pregnancy test breastfeed woman Simultaneous plan subsequent femoral vein access Allergy component closure material left groin Puncture closure closure device site < 30 day Puncture closure manuel compression site < 5 day Patients peripheral artery disease include operator discretion except heavy calcification present access site , operator discretion precludes insertion closure device
